pr_title: NXP-28502: Fix permanent deletion of folder containing a large number…

timeline.bodyText:
Checks if child document for a given document are  "purgeable/untrashable".
for the second line Documents need to be i....you can link the second method directly {@link #canPurgeOrUntrash(DocumentModel, NuxeoPrincipal)}
timeline.author: RSalem07
RSalem07

timeline.bodyText: here you don't give enough informations, which method will replace the deprecated once,  CoreSession#query(String) with a limit its not enough because perhaps the called want the total document without using limit. Perhaps just @deprecated since 11.1, not scalable or not used anymore or at least you can propose to replace it by BAF
timeline.author: RSalem07
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -167,7 +178,9 @@ default void untrashDocument(DocumentModel doc) {
      * @param parent The parent document of trash document.
      * @return All documents in the trash of the current document.
      * @since 7.1
+     * @deprecated since 11.1 not scalable (prefer to use directly {@link CoreSession#query(String)} with a limit
      */

timeline.bodyText: you can replace it @Deprecated(since = "11.1", forRemoval = true)
timeline.author: RSalem07
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -167,7 +178,9 @@ default void untrashDocument(DocumentModel doc) {
      * @param parent The parent document of trash document.
      * @return All documents in the trash of the current document.
      * @since 7.1
+     * @deprecated since 11.1 not scalable (prefer to use directly {@link CoreSession#query(String)} with a limit
      */
+    @Deprecated(since = "11.1")

timeline.bodyText:
do we need Document and Relation ? as there is no joins, i am not sure how this query will be interpreted.
furthermore  can you please give a name field with more context GET_DOCUMENTS_BY_UUID_QUERY or something else
timeline.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText: In other hand we shouldn't given a specific methods on this Repo scroller, just call it from outside using the builder and give you query see org.nuxeo.ecm.core.scroll.TestRepositoryScroll for examples
replies.author: RSalem07

timeline.author: RSalem07

timeline.bodyText:
what do you want to test here:

that you can purge the folder children
or purge folder and children

i ask this question depending on you answer the java doc should be update / reworked on getCanEmptyTrash method ...
timeline.author: RSalem07

timeline.bodyText:
here  calling RespositoryScroll#loadDocuments,  you will not scroll a second time ? is it right
just make query on the CoreSession#query or extract a method in the TrashService but we should care about what scroll.next() returns i means how the size of the documents list will be, because in some SQL DB there is some limitation when you make IN for example Oracle don't accepts more then 1000 with IN clause , Florent / Benoit can give more feedbacks
timeline.author: RSalem07

timeline.bodyText:
Return -> replace it by Gets  and
for the javadoc on protected method  we can ask the team because i am not sure about the rule, from my point of view it will help us to have the javadoc on protected for nuxeo usage....
timeline.author: RSalem07

timeline.bodyText: we dont change the protected/public methods signature for backward compatibility just create a new once and call it from the exiting once
timeline.author: RSalem07

timeline.bodyText: need to be formatted, extra space needed on the
timeline.author: RSalem07

timeline.bodyText: With this premature exit you change/break the exiting behaviour of this method as before you changed it, it main purpose was to give more informations about the trash state, and now you exit the method if your check is true  i think we should rework it depending on the need
timeline.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText:
The behavior is only changed if the exitOnFirstDelta is true, which by default is false in the new internal call so the behavior is still the same:
d61fa8f#diff-7c7663426b7649bd97453eaa63571db0R122
Not advocating for a way or another though
replies.author: NourNuxeo

replies.bodyText: finally roll-backed to reduice commit impact to jsf bean only
replies.author: ThierryCasanova

replies.bodyText:
@NourNuxeo about #3693 (comment) here the method is changed on its behaviour, before adding parameters the method will take each parameter as a filter for the process but the new once will exit the loop which is different.
as discussed with thierry this change is not required and it's why he rollback it
replies.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText:
Of course it does extra stuff, that's why he changes it. But it still behaves the same way in the places it was called before.
Yes I followed up with the discussion about the rollback 👍
replies.author: NourNuxeo

replies.bodyText:
Of course it does extra stuff, that's why he changes it. But it still behaves the same way in the places it was called before.

i know why he changed it,  but i don't agree with this modification as the new method now can do more then just filter and any one can called it without knowing exactly what means the new parameter
replies.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText: The method was protected and the param was named. But I like method who do only one thing better than the multi behavioral ones for sure.
replies.author: NourNuxeo

timeline.bodyText: no need for deprecated on Override method as you did it on the interface one
